title: High-Resolution STEM Cathodoluminescence of 2D Exfoliated Quantum Emitters
content: Two-dimensional (2D) exfoliated materials with Van der Waalâ€™s interlayer bonding have attracted significant attention in recent years for their potential as quantum emitters that are critical towards quantum information science. Hexagonal boron nitrite (hBN) has a layered structure and a bandgap near 6eV [1]. The hBN materials have been engineered extensively to create quantum emitters. A library of emission lines has been reported from ultraviolet light to near infrared light regime with different fabrications and treatments on hBN.
